- Rank 1: tom watson with 3 wins

3 (tom watson) + 1 (mark o'meara) + 1 (andy bean) + 3 (denis watson) + 2 (tom kite) = 10.

So the combined wins from the top five players add up to exactly 10, which supports the claim. 

Now, regarding the relevant cells: each row in the table has a rank, player name, country, earnings, events, and wins. Since we're concerned with the "wins" column for the top five players (ranks 1 through 5), the relevant columns are "rank", "player", and "wins".

So, for each of the top five players (ranks 1 to 5), their "wins" cell is relevant. Therefore, the relevant_cells will include each of these rows' "wins" column.

The claim is TRUE because the total number of wins from the top five players in 1984 adds up to 10.
